creator: nectanebi@web.de
text:
I have downloaded jakarta-tomcat-4.0.1.exe from your ftp-server for my Win2K.
I have allready a installation of jbuilder, with jdk1.3 inside, on my machine.
The JAVA_HOME system-enviroment-variable ist set to the right path and included 
in the PATH

But for some strange reason your installation-procedure says:
Couldn't find a JDK installed on this computer. Please download ...

What's wrong?
How is the installation actually testing the presence of the JDK?

creator: remm@apache.org
text:
Due to some limititions with the current installer technology used, the current 
installer needs the registry keys set by the installer of the Sun JDK for 
Windows. So it just won't work in your case (sorry).
